t: Luke 20
The Authority of Jesus Challenged
One*p day as he was teaching the people in the temple and proclaiming the good news, the chief priests and the scribes, with the elders, came
and said to him, “Tell us, by what authority are you doing these things? Who is it who gave you this authority?”
He*p answered them, “I*r will*r also*r ask*r you*r a*r question.*r Tell*r me,*r
was*r the*r baptism*r of*r John*r from*r heaven*r or*r of*r human*r origin?”*r
They*p discussed it among themselves: “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Why didn’t you believe him?’
But if we say, ‘Of human origin,’ all the people will stone us, because they are convinced that John was a prophet.”
So they answered that they did not know its origin.
And*p Jesus said to them, “Neither*r will*r I*r tell*r you*r by*r what*r authority*r I*r do*r these*r things.”*r
The Parable of the Vineyard Owner
Now*p he began to tell the people this parable: “A*r man*r planted*r a*r vineyard,*r leased*r it*r to*r tenant*r farmers,*r and*r went*r away*r for*r a*r long*r time.*r

At*r harvest*r time*r he*r sent*r a*r servant*r to*r the*r farmers*r so*r that*r they*r might*r give*r him*r some*r fruit*r from*r the*r vineyard.*r But*r the*r farmers*r beat*r him*r and*r sent*r him*r away*r empty-handed.*r
He*r sent*r yet*r another*r servant,*r but*r they*r beat*r that*r one*r too,*r treated*r him*r shamefully,*r and*r sent*r him*r away*r empty-handed.*r
And*r he*r sent*r yet*r a*r third,*r but*r they*r wounded*r this*r one*r too*r and*r threw*r him*r out.*r
“Then*rp the*r owner*r of*r the*r vineyard*r said,*r ‘What*r should*r I*r do?*r I*r will*r send*r my*r beloved*r son.*r Perhaps*r they*r will*r respect*r him.’*r

“But*rp when*r the*r tenant*r farmers*r saw*r him,*r they*r discussed*r it*r among*r themselves*r and*r said,*r ‘This*r is*r the*r heir.*r Let’s*r kill*r him,*r so*r that*r the*r inheritance*r will*r be*r ours.’*r
So*r they*r threw*r him*r out*r of*r the*r vineyard*r and*r killed*r him.*r “What*rp then*r will*r the*r owner*r of*r the*r vineyard*r do*r to*r them?*r
He*r will*r come*r and*r kill*r those*r farmers*r and*r give*r the*r vineyard*r to*r others.”*r But*p when they heard this they said, “That must never happen!”
But*p he looked at them and said, “Then*r what*r is*r the*r meaning*r of*r this*r Scripture:*r The*irpn stone*ir that*ir the*ir builders*ir rejected*ir has*irln become*ir the*ir cornerstone?*ir
Everyone*rp who*r falls*r on*r that*r stone*r will*r be*r broken*r to*r pieces,*r but*r on*r whomever*r it*r falls,*r it*r will*r shatter*r him.”*r
Then*p the scribes and the chief priests looked for a way to get their hands on him that very hour, because they knew he had told this parable against them, but they feared the people.
God and Caesar
They*p watched closely and sent spies who pretended to be righteous, so that they could catch him in what he said, to hand him over to the governor’s rule and authority.
They questioned him, “Teacher, we know that you speak and teach correctly, and you don’t show partiality but teach truthfully the way of God.
Is it lawful for us to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”
But*p detecting their craftiness, he said to them,
“Show*r me*r a*r denarius.*r Whose*r image*r and*r inscription*r does*r it*r have?”*r “Caesar’s,”*p they said.
“Well*rp then,”*r he told them, “give*r to*r Caesar*r the*r things*r that*r are*r Caesar’s,*r and*r to*r God*r the*r things*r that*r are*r God’s.”*r
They*p were not able to catch him in what he said in public, and being amazed at his answer, they became silent.
The Sadducees and the Resurrection
Some*p of the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came up and questioned him:

“Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if*i a*i man’s*i brother*i has*i a*i wife,*i and*i dies*i childless,*i his*i brother*i should*i take*i the*i wife*i and*i produce*i offspring*i for*i his*i brother.*i
Now there were seven brothers. The first took a wife and died without children.
Also the second
and the third took her. In the same way, all seven died and left no children.
Finally, the woman died too.
In the resurrection, therefore, whose wife will the woman be? For all seven had married her.”
Jesus*p told them, “The*r children*r of*r this*r age*r marry*r and*r are*r given*r in*r marriage.*r
But*r those*r who*r are*r counted*r worthy*r to*r take*r part*r in*r that*r age*r and*r in*r the*r resurrection*r from*r the*r dead*r neither*r marry*r nor*r are*r given*r in*r marriage.*r
For*r they*r can*r no*r longer*r die,*r because*r they*r are*r like*r angels*r and*r are*r children*r of*r God,*r since*r they*r are*r children*r of*r the*r resurrection.*r

Moses*r even*r indicated*r in*r the*r passage*r about*r the*r burning*r bush*r that*r the*r dead*r are*r raised,*r where*r he*r calls*r the*r Lord*r the*ir God*ir of*ir Abraham*ir and*ir the*ir God*ir of*ir Isaac*ir and*ir the*ir God*ir of*ir Jacob.*ir
He*r is*r not*r the*r God*r of*r the*r dead*r but*r of*r the*r living,*r because*r all*r are*r living*r to*r him.”*r
Some*p of the scribes answered, “Teacher, you have spoken well.”
And they no longer dared to ask him anything.
The Question about the Messiah
Then*p he said to them, “How*r can*r they*r say*r that*r the*r Messiah*r is*r the*r son*r of*r David?*r
For*r David*r himself*r says*r in*r the*r Book*r of*r Psalms:*r The*irpn Lord*ir declared*ir to*ir my*ir Lord,*ir ‘Sit*irln at*ir my*ir right*ir hand*ir
until*irln I*ir make*ir your*ir enemies*ir your*ir footstool.’*ir
David*rp calls*r him*r ‘Lord.’*r How,*r then,*r can*r he*r be*r his*r son?”*r
Warning against the Scribes
While*p all the people were listening, he said to his disciples,

“Beware*r of*r the*r scribes,*r who*r want*r to*r go*r around*r in*r long*r robes*r and*r who*r love*r greetings*r in*r the*r marketplaces,*r the*r best*r seats*r in*r the*r synagogues,*r and*r the*r places*r of*r honor*r at*r banquets.*r
They*r devour*r widows’*r houses*r and*r say*r long*r prayers*r just*r for*r show.*r These*r will*r receive*r harsher*r judgment.”*r
